Martita Fort recordó a Ricardo en el día que cumpliría 51 años
05 Nov 2019 by Redacción Diario de Cuyo
Este 5 de noviembre, Martita Fort (15), la hija del recordado chocolatero, comenzó el día recordando a su padre en las redes sociales con un especial posteo.
Es que Ricardo Fort hubiera cumplido 51 años y la adolescente no quiso perderse la oportunidad de "presentarles (a sus 382.000 seguidores de Instagram) a un hombre que todos conocieron".
En detalle, la heredera del fallecido mediático, quien dejó este mundo hace ya seis años, compartió en su cuenta de esa red social una imagen de ella junto a su mellizo, Felipe (15), y su papá.



En la postal ambos aparecen junto a su progenitor, quien sostiene una taza de café y sonríe a la cámara. "Me gustaría presentarles a un hombre que todos conocieron: Ricardo Fort, mi padre", comienza diciendo Martita en el texto que acompaña esa imagen.
Y continúa: "Sí, digo presentárselos porque hoy mi papá cumpliría años y mi papá y el Ricardo de la tele no eran la misma persona para mí. Cómo también me gustaría que me cuenten quién era él para ustedes que lo miraban en su lugar preferido, la tele".
"Artista era siempre, tanto en la tele como en casa frente a su compu pensando cosas para hacer o cantando en su piano", agregó la joven al recordar su infancia.



Y sobre aquellos días felices y de una exposición total de su padre sumó: "A veces le gritaba como un loco a la TV respondiéndole a alguien que hablaba de él. Eso era: artista y pasional, espero poder haber heredado de él su pasión y su creatividad".
Entonces, luego de repetir ese deseo: "Espero encontrar mi lugar en la vida como lo hizo él"; Martita completó: "Y este es el único homenaje válido, celebrar su nacimiento, porque gracias a él yo llegue a este mundo y estoy rodeada de los afectos que él se aseguró que yo tuviera".
Cabe destacar que Marta y Felipe nacieron a través de una subrogación de vientre y se criaron sin mamá. En tanto, desde el fallecimiento de Ricardo ellos quedaron a cargo de Gustavo Martínez, su tutor legal.
"Encima de que no teníamos mamá, crecer sin un papá es más complicado", sostuvo Felipe durante una entrevista para Cortá por Lozano (Telefe, a las 14.30). Y agregó: "No tener una mamá fue más fácil, porque directamente desde que nacimos no tuvimos mamá".
"Gustavo sería como nuestra mamá. Él nos cuida. Nunca nos castigó y nos enseña valores. Se enoja, pero le gusta más expresarlo con palabras", agregó por su parte la hija del mediático, quien este año celebró su cumpleaños de 15 con una mega fiesta en Puerto Madero que reunió a más de 250 invitados.
Y cerró, divertida: "Como tenemos confianza, tampoco hay mentiras de por medio. A veces, me dice: '¡¡Marta, sos muy honesta!!'". 
"Querido e inolvidable Richard. Tu hija Martita hoy va a festejar sus 15 con una increíble fiesta bien a tu manera. Tu hija tiene tanto de vos que es imposible olvidarte. ¡¡¡Te extraño mucho!!! Siempre", escribió el tutor de Martita y Felipe en la previa del imponente festejo.
text:
Martita Fort remembered Ricardo on the day she would turn 51
05 Nov 2019 by Cuyo Daily Writing
This November 5, Martita Fort (15), the daughter of the remembered chocolate maker, began the day remembering her father in social networks with a special post.
Is that Ricardo Fort had turned 51 and the teenager did not want to miss the opportunity to "introduce (to her 382,000 Instagram followers) to a man they all knew."
In detail, the heiress of the deceased media, who left this world six years ago, shared in her account of that social network an image of her next to her twin, Felipe (15), and her father.



In the postcard they both appear next to their father, who holds a cup of coffee and smiles at the camera. "I would like to introduce you to a man you all knew: Ricardo Fort, my father," Martita begins by saying in the text that accompanies that image.
And he continues: "Yes, I say introduce them to you because today my dad would turn years old and my dad and Ricardo on TV were not the same person for me. How would I also like to be told who he was for you who were watching him in his favorite place? , the TV".
"Artist was always, both on TV and at home in front of his computer thinking things to do or singing on his piano," the young woman added as she remembered her childhood.



And about those happy days and a total exposure of his father added: "Sometimes he yelled like a madman to the TV responding to someone who talked about him. That was: artist and passionate, I hope to have inherited his passion and your creativity. "
Then, after repeating that desire: "I hope to find my place in life as he did"; Martita completed: "And this is the only valid tribute, to celebrate his birth, because thanks to him I came to this world and I am surrounded by the affections he made sure I had."
It should be noted that Marta and Felipe were born through a belly subrogation and were raised without a mother. Meanwhile, since Ricardo's death they were in charge of Gustavo Martínez, his legal guardian.
"On top of the fact that we didn't have a mother, growing up without a father is more complicated," Felipe said during an interview for Cortá by Lozano (Telefe, at 14.30). He added: "Not having a mother was easier, because directly since we were born we had no mother."
"Gustavo would be like our mother. He takes care of us. He never punished us and teaches us values. He gets angry, but he likes to express it more in words," added the media daughter, who celebrated her 15th birthday this year with a mega party in Puerto Madero that brought together more than 250 guests.
And he closed, amused: "As we have confidence, there are no lies in between either. Sometimes, he tells me: 'Marta, you are very honest !!'"
"Dear and unforgettable Richard. Your daughter Martita today is going to celebrate her 15 with an incredible party well in your own way. Your daughter has so much of you that it is impossible to forget you. I miss you so much !!! Always," wrote the tutor of Martita and Felipe in the previous one of the imposing celebration.
